lead_paragraph: BETTENCOURT--Anthony. Anthony James Bettencourt Jr. passed away early on Saturday morning, July 2, 2016, after a brave and courageous battle with cancer and an ailing heart. He was gentle, kind and loving--for all of his days. He was a warrior and always positive throughout his illness. Anthony was born in Niles, California and graduated from Washington High School in Fremont, CA. He was a Vietnam Veteran, serving early in the Navy. He worked hard all of his life as a laborer, doing great harm to his body to provide well for his family. In his retirement, he became an accomplished wood worker and happily attended to his rose garden. His greatest joy came from his wife of 57 years and his four granddaughters, with whom he was smitten. Anthony is survived by his loving wife, Sydney; devoted son Anthony of Pleasanton CA, and grandchildren, Jessica Bettencourt of New York City, NY, Candace Bettencourt of San Francisco, CA, Ashley Bettencourt of San Francisco, CA, and Tory Bettencourt of Boston, MA. He is also survived by his sisters, Patricia Rehrig of Milpitas, CA, and Doreen Ellsworth of Monrovia, CA. His generous spirit will be missed by all that knew him. Friends and family are invited to funeral services on Thursday July 7, 2016 at 11:00am at Graham-Hitch Mortuary, 4167 First Street, Pleasanton, CA 94566. Burial to follow at Irvington Memorial Cemetery in Fremont. 1/3
